questions.question: What about the copybooks COTTL01Y (line 76, used for titles like CCDA-TITLE01 at 323), CSMSG01Y (line 78, used for messages like CCDA-MSG-INVALID-KEY at 139), and CVACT03Y (line 81)? They are missing from copybooks_used.

In data_flow.reads_from ACCTDAT, fields_used lists 'XREF-ACCT-ID' with citations [170,193], but line 170 MOVEs ACTIDINI to XREF-ACCT-ID (for CXACAIX key), and 193 is ACCT-CURR-BAL. Does ACCOUNT-RECORD (CVACT01Y) contain XREF-ACCT-ID, or is this incorrect?
The cics_operations section lists some commands but omits several like READ for CXACAIX (line 410), STARTBR TRANSACT (443), READPREV (474), ENDBR (503), and FORMATTIME (255). What about these?

In inputs.COBIL0AI, CURBALI is listed as an 'input field (displayed balance)', but lines 193-194 MOVE ACCT-CURR-BAL to CURBALI OF COBIL0AI after reading the file. Is CURBALI truly user input or an output field populated from DB?

In error_handling, several file operations have NOTFND/OTHER error paths (e.g., READ-CXACAIX-FILE lines 423-435, STARTBR-TRANSACT-FILE 451-467), but only ACCTDAT READ is listed. What about error handling for other files?

In data_flow.reads_from for ACCTDAT, fields_used includes 'XREF-ACCT-ID' with citations [170,193], but line 170 MOVEs ACTIDINI to XREF-ACCT-ID before the READ (line 345), and line 193 uses ACCT-CURR-BAL; XREF-ACCT-ID is set from input, not read from the file. Is this accurate?

In inputs.COBIL0AI, 'CURBALI (balance display)' is listed under input description with citations [308,312], but lines 193-194 MOVE ACCT-CURR-BAL to CURBALI after reading ACCTDAT. Is CURBALI a user-modifiable input or a display-only field populated from the database?
What about the usage of copybook CVACT03Y (copied at line 81)? It is listed with 'usage unclear from source', and no fields from it appear to be referenced in the code.

In business_rules.BR002, N/n performs CLEAR-CURRENT-SCREEN and sets ERR-FLG 'Y' (no account read/display), while spaces/low-values performs READ-ACCTDAT-FILE to display balance (no pay). Should these be distinguished in the rule description?

In error_handling for READPREV-TRANSACT, it notes 'OTHER (ENDFILE sets ZEROS TRAN-ID)' with [484,491], but ENDFILE is handled separately at line 488 by setting ZEROS without error, while OTHER sets error. Does this conflate the conditions?
